title: Can't find my device listed on "Can't find my device."
content:
I (1) lost my device but (2) cannot find it on "find my device" even though it is (3) listed as linked to my account.

I am absolutely sure I am signed in to the right account. (Please ask me how I know if you think I am mistaken.)

I did not realize the device was lost for a several weeks. (It's not my phone, see note at end.) It is really lost, too, not misplaced; it might be anywhere.

I realize I have probably lost it for good. But would like to try whatever there is to try.

I have recently used "find my device" to find this device (you know, making it ring). When I did that, there were other options that would be good to do now, such as "lock your phone" and put a message on the lock screen. It provides these options for other devices I have. And, the device was listed!

If I could, I'd like to lock it and leave a message. Is there any way I can?

Why isn't the device listed with the others any more? Does it mean someone has wiped it and taken it over?

I'll probably end up buying a replacement. When I do, I would like to restore to it my old device software and settings--to restore from backup. Will I still be able to do that? How?

I just feel as though I am missing something obvious.

Final disclosure: The device is a Nexus 7, not a Pixel (though I do own a Pixel 3A, which is not lost). The Nexus help forum is long gone, so I came here. The issue is not device-specific.

Thanks for any advice.
